turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Central Committee of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union.
turn.1: What was the role of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union in the Soviet Union?
turn.2: It published their works, wrote biographies, collected and stored documents on the prominent figures of the party, collected and published the magazine "Questions on Party History".
turn.3: What else did the Central Committee do?
turn.4: It also published monographs and collected documents related to Marxism–Leninism, the history of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union, Party affairs, scientific communism and history of the international communist movement.
turn.5: Did the committee do anything else important?
turn.6: A resolution of the Central Committee on 25 June 1968 provided the IML with the right to guide affiliate organisations – the Institute of History of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of the union republics, the Leningrad Regional Committee, the Museum of Karl Marx and Friedrich Engels, the Central Museum of Vladimir.
turn.7: What other rights did the IML have?
turn.8: Lenin and other affiliate organisastions, the coordination of all research in the field of historical-party science, observation of the publication of scientific papers and works of art and literature about the life and work of the classics of Marxism–Leninism, to provide scientific guidance on the subject of the old Bolsheviks.
turn.9: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.10: In 1972 the IML was divided into 9 departments which focused on; the works of Marx and Engels, the works of Lenin, the history of party-building, scientific communism, the history of the international communist movement, coordination branches of research, the Central Party Archive, the Party Library, the Museum of Karl Marx and Friedrich Engels.
turn.12: The Institute of Social Sciences (Russian: Институт общественных наук) was established in 1962.
